attributes.action: Amendments to MP conduct rules to restrict sitting MP's work as broadcasters
attributes.additional_details: I believe that it is inappropriate for members of Parliament to be allowed to frame current affairs and political discourse in a public forum without moderation. Open and fair discourse is essential to the functioning of a democracy and an impartial press is key to this. Further more I believe that MP's analysis on current affairs should always be presented with full transparency regarding not only their opinions but their voting history.
attributes.background: Amendments should restrict UK MPs from acting as hosts, long-term contributors or editors for current affairs broadcasting content. When contributing, MPs should be transparent about their involvement with related House business and disclose their voting history

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for. 
 
Decisions about MPs working as broadcasters are a matter for Ofcom, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

Here are the Ofcom broadcasting standards: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/news-centre/2023/ofcoms-rules-on-politicians-on-tv-and-radio
